intro: Euphrasia slovaca, commonly known as the Slovak eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent dark veins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are oval-shaped with hairy surfaces, and it produces numerous tiny flowers in clusters. Euphrasia slovaca is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
